case_vignette: A 22-year-old man presented with complaints of painful lesions on his penis and swelling in the left groin that started 10 days ago. He denied fever, chills, night sweats, rashes, dysuria, discharge, testicular pain, or proctitis. His female partner had been diagnosed with chlamydia one year earlier but he has not undergone evaluation. Multiple small, nontender scabbed lesions are identified in the bilateral scrotal area and on the shaft of penis. The right inguinal lymph node was tender and swollen.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Genital herpes with probable concurrent lymphogranuloma venereum (LGV)

I have painful lesions on my penis and swelling in my left groin that started 10 days ago. Also, there are small, nontender scabbed lesions in the scrotal area and on the shaft of my penis, and my right groin lymph node is tender and swollen.
Have you had similar symptoms in the past?
No, I have not had similar symptoms in the past.

My female partner was diagnosed with chlamydia a year ago, but I have not been evaluated for it since then.

No, I do not have a fever, headache, or muscle aches.
Final Diagnosis: Genital herpes
